content.description: This route in not on the Lost Pensil, but on a formation about 5 min. west.   It is on the NW face of a buttress of rock.
content.protection: five bolts to a bolted anchor.
content.location: Climbs the left arete or edge of a somewhat narrow buttress.

climbs.name: Number Two (aka the Weasel Boys Arete)

content.description: A boulder problem start leads into continuous and technical climbing along the arete with great exposure and positioning. Four stars out of five.
content.location:
The obvious arete left of

Indian Giver

.

content.description: This is the route on the right arete of the somewhat narrow buttress with Sexy Bolt.
content.protection: five bolts to a bolted anchor  (same as for Sexy Bolt)
content.location: Located about 5 min. walk NW of Lost Pencil

climbs.name: Jailbird
climbs.fa: Vanessa Wentwoord, John Shippling, Peter Bohler, Matthew Navarro

content.description: Directly across from Sexy Bolt and New Shoes For Sunny is a large boulder.  Jailbird ascends this boulder.
content.protection: Three bolts to a bolted anchor.
content.location: About 5 min. walk NW from The Lost Pensil.  South facing.

content.description: Really fun route with great gear. Move through wide-ish lower section into the A-frame roof. Pull out of the roof and enjoy great jams to finish. Very worth it if in the area. Anyone know if this has been done before?
content.location: Not on Lost Pencil proper, but on the northwest face of the blob directly to the south.

climbs.name: [Redacted]
climbs.fa: Riverside Bunch, 1967, FFA: Jon Lonne & Dennis Johnson, January 1977

content.description:
Indian Giver is a bold route up the southwest face of the beautiful Lost Pencil pillar.  Thin, steep Joshua Tree face climbing that is very insecure.  A fall getting to the second bolt could be disastrous.

Start near a shallow dihedral by reaching/jumping to a large face hold on the right arete of the corner.  I think a hard mantle onto this hold is the true crux.  More hard face up and right gains another big jug.  A terrifying 5.10c mantle here to an obvious chossy jug and the second bolt.  Head up and right to the arete and the third bolt on big features.  Cross the arete on to easier runnout climbing and an awesome summit.

Considering the nature of the climbing, this is an impressive FFA for 1977!
content.protection: Three bomber bolts / two bolt rappel anchor - all new.
content.location:
The beautiful west face of the Lost Pencil.  This route starts up on the pedestal.  This route gets lots of sun from late in the morning on.

Approach via an easy 20 foot long chimney hidden by boulders on the west face or a short, sharp 5.8 hand crack about 20 feet to the left (north).

To descend, rappel all the way back down from the top to below the approach pitch west with a single 60 meter rope, best to use the route Number Two's anchor for this.  Watch your rope ends.

pathTokens: Jerry's Quarry and Lost Pencil Areas
